task.title: Running the org.oasis.pdf.committeeNote dita-ot plugin
task.abstract: Eberlein, 30 January 2019: This content is obsolete.This scenario documents the installation and running of the org.oasis.pdf.committeeNote plugin with dita-ot-2.3.3 on Windows 10

info.p: On my system, I installed dita-ot-2.3.3 as E:\plugin-testing\dita-ot-2.3.3_committeeNote. I have several dita-ot instances installed on my PC, so I chose to add the "_committeeNote" suffix the dita-ot install directory name.

step.cmd: Copy the org.oasis.pdf.committeeNote plugin from SVN dita/trunk/build to the dita-ot-2.3.3/plugins directory
Open a command prompt at the dita-ot-2.3.3 installation directory and enter bin\dita -install
Open another command prompt in the directory that contains your committee note
Use the dita command, from the dita-ot that you installed in the first step, to run the PDF output using format oasis-pdf-committeeNote.

steptroubleshooting.p: Error messages from the dita command are likely due to the committee note content. Run the committee note using the -f pdf format instead of the -f oasis-pdf-committeeNote format. If the errors still occur, then there is a problem with the committee note.

step.cmd: Go to the output directory and view your PDF output.
